noun.description: Fat from the abdomen of a pig that is rendered and clarified for use in cooking.

verb.description: Insert strips of fat or bacon in (meat) before cooking.
Embellish (talk or writing) with a variety of expressions.
examples: his conversation is larded with quotations from Coleridge

origin: Middle English (also denoting fat bacon or pork): from Old French bacon, from Latin lardum, laridum, related to Greek larinos fat.
